comment: Reading pretty much required because he'll either quiz you or  give you a "rush-write" on it. Rush-writes are prompts based on the reading, but are central to the overall theme. He lets you grade them yourself, but the catch is he takes up 2 students' rush-writes randomly so he can change your grade if you lied. Not too hard though.

This guy was an amazing professor.  The entire course was extremely well-taught, and the professor was always willing to help clear up any questions about assignments or grades.  This guy was clearly passionate about his job and it is much appreciated.

Super nice guy. He really cares about his students. That being said, do not take this class if you're someone who wants to get by, by doing nothing. I made an A, but I still had to study, pay attention in class, and read the required texts. I loved his class.

I was really not looking forward to this class because it was so boring to me in high school, but his class was extremely interesting! It is a lot of reading, but in class there are detailed discussions that pretty much go straight on the test, so if you read and pay attention to the discussions, you'll ace every test!

I was dreading taking World Lit during Maymester. I was expecting 4.5 hours of boredom for 10 days. The class turned out to be a pleasant surprise. There is a lot of reading, but the stories were not bad.  He kept the class interesting and lively. You can tell he really enjoys what he does. Highly recommended.

He made me adore detective fiction. Got an A, but I worked for it. It's a lot of reading, but about 80% of the readings are very interesting, so you'll want to read them. If you can't sit down and read for about 1-2 hours a night, don't take his class. Easy A if you can!

Very clear and his lectures were very informative, which made the class very interesting. A lot of rush writes or quizes  practically everyday. As long as you come to class and pay attention and do the assigned readying, you'll get a B or higher. I would take him again if I could.

I took this class because it fit my schedule. I HATE detective fiction. But by the end of the semester this was my fave class BECAUSE OF HIM! He is one of the best prof's I've been fortunate to have at KSU. I'd jump at the chance to take him again. Almost daily rush writes on ass'd reading. At first I didn't get the hot rating but after a bit I did
Fantastic professor. He is very clear in what he wants from his students. I really enjoyed his class.
Awesome professor!!!

Pay attention to when he says a quote from a book b/c quote spotting is the hardest part of the tests.  Come to class with an opinion on the reading (make sure you read them) and you will make and A for sure!

Excellent Professor! Pay attention to when he says a quote from a book b/c quote spotting is the hardest part of the tests.  Come to class with an opinion on the reading (make sure you read them) and you will make and A for sure!
Best professor for World Lit. is Dr. Emron Esplin, Took him for Maymester and it was easy. Got an A !!!!

I am not that interested in literature, but I really enjoyed this class.  Prof Esplin is a great teacher and picks some enjoyable reading material.  If you do the readings and pay attention to the discussions in class then the tests are easy and the class is an easy A.  Participation is a big grade and is based a lot on attendance.  GREAT TEACHER

Amusing and interesting. Tests are short answer/essay format and can be a beast, but if you read before class, attend regularly, and take notes you should do fine. Does "rush writes" and quizzes as in class assignments. Gives a participation grade that is affected by attendance. Assigns interesting reading material.
Pretty hip Professor. He's so casual, it's awesome. Go to class to get notes on reading assignments. Easy tests. His lectures and reading assignments were interesting. Loved him.

GREATTT TEACHER!! you must attend class bc you have a quiz everyday over the readings. alot to read but i used sparknotes on most of them. buy all books, show up to class, easy A. He's a funny teacher too.

He is an awesome professor. He makes the class interesting and I took him for maymester.  There were two test, a few quizes and a few rushwrites.  If you are willing to do the work, I can almost guaruntee you will get an A!
i made an A. i took him maymester and i would have to say that he has been my favorite professor ever! Take his class. there is alot of reading and notes but it was maymester so that is understood.
Professor esplin is honestly the best teacher i have ever had, and i HATE english. I had him for maymester so there was a lot of reading, but honestly he makes it worth it because he is the man.

Took him for Maymester and made an A. LOTS of reading, and an entire subject notebook full of notes, but well worth it.  Not only did I make an A, but I actually had to use my brain and get creative in analyzing the pieces.  Make sure to do the readings, take lots of notes..really hard not to pass.
Great teacher. if you hate english (world lit), take this guy for maymester. Tons of reading but it is well worth it. One of the best classes i've ever been in.

If you are not a fan of world lit like I am, take this class for maymester. He is dun and he make the class fun. There are lots of reading so be prepare to learn and have fun. Note always read the assigned reading If you love urself.

Very helpful and clear, he tests over concepts, not summaries - DO THE READING before class so the themes make sense & you aren't scrambling to understand what the stories are about. Lots of short stories, no papers but the tests are 75% free-response so study hard if you want an A. Can miss up to 3 days, 3 points off grade for each day after that.

I highly recommend him. I am taking him for the maymester... Everything on the test is right out of his lectures. Just review your notes and you should be good to go... He has a project/presentation due, which is pretty easy. I would take him again if I needed another English class.
Take him! You will not regret it!

Esplin is an AWESOME professor. STRONGLY recommended. You will have to read a lot, but the books are fairly interesting. He makes lectures as interesting and short as possible. You get 3 unexcused absences, then it starts to effect your grade.

Pay attention in class and take notes on his short lectures. One oral presentation, which was easy. Just read the short readings he gives and you'll be A-OK! Tests weren't bad, not papers. Can miss up to 3 classes. Easy A if you pay attention.

everyone likes this guy. Good class. All short stories, not a single paper. Interesting lectures. Tests are easy (pretty much entirely short answer) if you remember themes we talk about in class. Best english teacher I've had at KSU!

the problem that i had with dr esplin's class was that every week we read an entire book, rushwrote about it, some people did a presentation, and then they were done... My thing is I'm a BIG fan of explication, and it was an interesting class for sure, i just thought he could have spent more time going in depth with each book read in his class.

He is the best English teacher I've had since at KSU. You read a lot, and don't have any papers. Each person has to do a presentation on a short story, but that's about all. There are rushwrites at the beg. of class which really help for the tests, so save them! Take him take him take him!

I had him for Ethnic Literatures. We mainly read novels. His teaching style is diverse making his classes seem short. Esplin is very engaged during class.Show up and do the assignments and you'll be fine. This is a class where you take away a lot. Great ecperience.
GREAT

Maymester 2009. One of the best professors at KSU. Interesting and diverse readings. All the comments made about him from Maymester are true. Hope he stays at KSU for a long time - Something tells me he is not going to though.

I had him for maymester and there were only 2 tests - aced both. There were 2-3 rushwrites everyday sometimes a simple quiz. Wonderful guy. You have to give a presentation and he's more than willing to help you with it. I liked this class during maymester because the material was still fresh even though there were alot of readings since its shorter

I took this class for maymester and loved it. There is a lot of reading, so only take the class if you have plenty of time to read. You will be expected to participate in group discussion and there are two tests that are easy if you listen to discussions and read the stories. He makes the class interresting!

I just finished the maymester! I absolutely loved this class! He is a a very knowledgable teacher who is more than willing to help out his students! Do youre reading, attend class, pay attention and you'll do well and get a lot out of it! I defiantly recommend him to anyone!!

I just finished Dr. Emron's Maymester class today.  I'm not a lit person, but he made the class fun & engaging.  Of course there is a lot of reading, but many of the stories are fun to read.  Go to class, do the reading, listen & take notes.  He is very knowledgeable.  BTW, he concentrates on short stories/authors in the Americas.  Awesome teacher!

Nice guy. Seems interested in the subject and the students' involvement in class. 2 presentations, 1 close reading, and 2 tests. Overall, as long as you do the readings (imagine that in an english class...) you will do fine. It's a senior class, so class participation is expected and well thought out arguments in papers - but that's with any class.

I would definitely recommend this teacher! He is energetic and upbeat and shows his genuine interest of the subject. He makes the class very interesting. You definitely have to do the reading to do well in his class, but he doesn't assign too much reading so it's not difficult to keep up.

This class was very difficult. Three writing assignments without rubric guidance as to what was expected (the final paper being a minimum of 9 pages, due one day before the final).  He graded very harshly on all papers!

Esplin's world lit class is pretty easy to get through. If you do the work which is pretty much just reading and participate on your own, you'll get the grade. He can be a little dismissive but only the slightest bit and maybe it's just me. This is the easiest lit class i've taken. Tests are hard if you don't prepare.

Emron is great!  Not as much reading as you would expect from a world lit class -- its mostly short stories (ex: Edgar Allen Poe) -- all fantasy/horror stories! One midterm exam that should be easy if you did the reading.  Small quizzes and assignments in class.  Lots of small group discussions about the reading assignments. I definitely recommend!
